WRITING.TEXT: Ah ok nice, I used to paint a lot with oil paints and a little bit with water color but water colors tend to screw up my line work, so for my style Copics are like God sent. I have this little window every morning before work when I can draw in this style so that also makes the markers a great choice for me. I wonder if we have used the same kind of copics because the once I use blend suuuper nice, they just flow into each other.

Haha, I would say the straight opposite. The copic markers I use blends smooth as hell, its like painting with very controlled water colors. I can get super strong colors, I however often try to tone them down as I like that more. The only thin I agree on is that they are a bit pricey. I would agree on all points if we where talking about any other brand of markers as they fit your description perfectly. What medium do you like to work in?
What do you mean? Have you tried Copic markers?
But but but, it got a pinup painted on it :P

WRITING.TITLE: Pin-up battle bird, Ballpoint pen and Copic markers, A4

WRITING.TEXT: Its just simple cheap color pencils but you can work magic with them. But if you are already very skilled with colors and know what you are doing then I recommend copics as they speed up the process. They run dry very fast though and are very expensive. I would never use them if I was on a tight budget.
Haha not bad, not bad at all
Staedtler colour pencils. Not markers but I think they works just as great, very cheap and more control.
Haha thank you! I guess if I would put all my skeletons I have made together they would be a series :)
Well I used Staedtler colour pencils for the longest time. I almost prefer those over the copics as it gives me more control of the process.
I had another name for this from the begining but somebody on imgur mentioned that it looked like him so I had to change it :)
Thank you! Well not all ballpoint pens work. I use the really cheap pilot hi-tec pens and they work great.
Thank you!
Thank you! Well it varies a little bit, Normally around 3 hours but the boat one took much longer, maybe 8 hours.

WRITING.TITLE: Nelson the skeleton dog, Ballpoint pen Copics, A4

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you for taking time to tell me this, It always makes my day to hear things like this :) Thank you!

Sorry for spamming the forum with my drawings, but I thought this one turned out a bit funny so I thought I would share it with you guys.
For more: https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/

WRITING.TITLE: Bullfinch Dog, Ballpoint pen Copic markers , A4

WRITING.TEXT: I dont really have any special trick for blending so I dont know what to say about that :)
Just take a ink pen and draw a line in the middle of the page or something, Then just keep doing that until it looks like something. Nobody will care if you make misstakes, just have fun.
Thank you!
Thank you! Glad to hear it :D

Thank you (Im a sir) I used to draw a lot digitally a couple of years back but I sort of realized that digital art looses the soul of the artist. Then I found my grand grandfather's sketchbook from when he was young and that inspired me. The effort he put into his pages inspired me to make every page count plus that feeling of somebody finding my sketchbooks in a 100 years is a bit thrilling haha. Hope they have a blast looking trough them.
Yea I got to start doing something else, maybe hybrid cars! oh wait.
Ah yes, I do work with tattoos :) Here is that Instagram if you didnt find it: https://www.instagram.com/deadpigeontattoo/
Thank you! I usually dont but if its something that I find extra interesting I might do it.
Haha, thank you :)
Its all about just finding the right brand that doesn't smear. My favorit is Pilot hi-tech.
When I made this I wasn't thinking about doing a Kirin but now when you mention it. It is pretty much a darker version of a Kirin :)
its 3 copics that I have been layering. Thank you!
Haha yea it does a bit :)
I use a Pilot Hi-tec ballpoint pen and Copic doesn't smear that :)
Thank you!
Thank you! It would be pretty cool to see them in a good game indeed.
Hehe, I live in Japan full time so Im familiar with the Kirin and yea there are a lot of cool creatures in Japanese mythology. Also nice beer on a hot day!
Haha

Yes there is such a thing as marker paper, however the paper I use is just labeled "sketchbook". I have bought and tried so many sketchbooks before I found the combination I was happy with, So I guess its just trial and error until you find yours. My particular sketchbook is from a Swedish paper company that is only sold in Sweden sadly.
Thank you! Well I have pretty much all of it here: https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/
I usually always tend to use a lot of color, but I managed to stay with only black and grey for once. Much fun, hope you like it :)

WRITING.TITLE: Deer-Dragon, Ballpoint pen Copic markers, A4

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you! :)
Thank you and yes, wouldn't that be something :)
Oh and thank you! :)
How about a Swan fused with a Black widow fused with a Dragon? :)

Pretty much all my drawings happen like this. I stare at the paper until I get a little glimpse of something and then it just comes to life by its own somehow. What is very well thought out is the balance of it and the coloring. I just keep balancing colors and shapes until it sort of resembles what I was going for. I draw the base design with a ballpoint pen without sketching anything out first, so I embed all the misstakes I do into the final design and that adds soul to it.
Did that answer your question?
I have one really old video from 4 years ago. Its really bad quality and in a bad angle but you will see the whole process :) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T5m2HPItLBk
Haha, thank you :) Yea this could probably fit into some kind of game I guess :)
Haha ok, sorry I missed that one
Im not sure its anything at all :P

So, a Swan a dragon and a black widow got drunk one night.
https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/

WRITING.TITLE: Swan Widow, Ballpoint pens and markers, A4

WRITING.TEXT: Ah ok, I understand, Copic markers got pretty much all colors and gradients you can think and they blend together. I think I used 6 colors on the eyes so thats how I did it :)

Normally when I draw other stuff I pre-sketch everything just like you normally would (Working as a tattoo artist), But by me having this style of mine where Im allowed to just go for it and make it work, it has helped my regular drawing speed a lot. Yepp your art teacher knows what he/she is talking about :)
Not 100% sure what area you are referring to but its all copic markers and magic. Mostly the copics :P

Thank you, I usually mix dark motives with bright colors, Its my way of evening things out, if that makes sense. Why my line work looks the way it does is because I dont pre sketch anything. I start with the ballpoint pen directly so any misstakes needs to become a part of the finale drawing in way or another :)
Haha, thank you

This mornings drawing, Hope you like it :)
For more: https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon

WRITING.TEXT: Haha this will match what I am about to upload so perfectly! Nice work.
Thank you! I didn't want to spam the art section to much with my drawings so I let it rest for a while :)
That makes me happy, Thanks :)
